visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts timeline chart displaying significant events in space exploration from 2000 to 2024. The chart should have a title 'Timeline of Space Exploration' and a subtitle linking to the source of the information. The axes should be hidden, and the chart should use a specific set of custom colors for the timeline markers. The data series should include the name and description of each event, formatted appropriately for Highcharts.

data.name: 2000: Orbiting of an asteroid
data.description: 14 February 2000, first orbiting of an asteroid (433 Eros).

data.name: 2005: Landing on Titan.
data.description: 14 January 2005, first soft landing on Titan also first soft landing in the outer Solar System.

data.name: 2011: Orbit of Mercury
data.description: 18 March 2011, first spacecraft to orbit Mercury.

data.name: 2015: Food eaten in space
data.description: 10 August 2015, first food grown in space and eaten (lettuce).

data.name: 2019: Black hole photograph
data.description: 10 April 2019, first direct photograph of a black hole and its vicinity.

data.name: 2024: Moon Sample
data.description: 25 June 2024, First samples returned from the far side of the Moon.

visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts configuration is designed to render a timeline chart that visualizes key events in space exploration from 2000 to 2024. The chart type is set to 'timeline', which is suitable for displaying events along a time axis. The title of the chart is 'Timeline of Space Exploration', and a subtitle is included to credit the source of the information. The x-axis and y-axis are both set to be invisible, focusing the viewer's attention on the timeline markers. The chart uses a custom set of colors for the markers, which are defined in the 'colors' array. The data series contains six events, each with a name and a description, which are formatted to be displayed appropriately in the timeline. Additional accessibility features are included to enhance the chart's usability for screen readers.
